definition: with one's heart set on speeding home (idiom)

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: I'm anxious to go back home as I've been away for a very long time.
sentences.chinese: 我已經好久沒有回家了，此刻真是歸心似箭。

sentences.english: Those who let Yao Ming impatient to get back is in Houston's wife.
sentences.chinese: 讓姚明歸心似箭的還是在休斯敦的妻子。

sentences.english: The lost child is impatient to come back.

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
Every family goes through its problems. (idiom)
pinyin: jia1 jia1 you3 ben3 nan2 nian4 de5 jing1

definition: out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
